newsitem.title: USA: Scripps to buy Harte-Hanks properties.
newsitem.headline: Scripps to buy Harte-Hanks properties.

text.p: E.W. Scripps Co. said on Monday it agreed to buy six newspapers, a television station and a radio station from Harte-Hanks Communications Inc. for between $605 million and $625 million, mostly in stock.

Scripps said the deal would result in about 5 percent dilution to its earnings in the first year, but should add to profits by the second or third year. Scripps also authorized the repurchase on the open market of as many of its shares as are issued to Harte-Hanks.
